title: XeTeX
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415054123/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Software](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415054123/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Software) : [Design Applications](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415054123/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Design%20Applications) : XeTeX**

XeTeX is a document preparation system based on the [TeX](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415054123/http:/typophile.com/wiki/TeX) typesetting program and works with both [LaTeX](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415054123/http:/typophile.com/wiki/LaTeX) and [ConTeXt](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415054123/http:/typophile.com/wiki/ConTeXt). It is created by [Jonathan Kew](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415054123/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Jonathan%20Kew) of [SIL](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415054123/http:/typophile.com/wiki/SIL) to be used with Unicode, currently it supports [OpenType](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415054123/http:/typophile.com/wiki/OpenType) and [AAT](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415054123/http:/typophile.com/wiki/AAT).

[http://scripts.sil.org/xetex](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415054123/http:/scripts.sil.org/xetex "http://scripts.sil.org/xetex")
author: Kess
